title: Add matching PWA splash screen for Boostly

requirements.text: Create a Boostly PWA splash screen image set that visually matches the current Boostly blue‑whitish icon style (clean, high-contrast, centered composition, safe padding). Add the splash images as static assets under frontend/public/assets/generated using the exact filenames specified in the image requirements.
acceptanceCriteria: All specified splash screen image files exist in frontend/public/assets/generated with the exact filenames and dimensions listed in imageRequirements.required.
Each splash image is purely visual, centered, and remains readable/correctly composed when cropped slightly by device safe areas (no important elements near edges).

requirements.text: Wire up iOS/Apple PWA splash screen support by adding appropriate <link rel="apple-touch-startup-image"> tags in frontend/index.html that reference the generated splash images and use correct media queries for their dimensions and orientation.
acceptanceCriteria: frontend/index.html includes apple-touch-startup-image link tags that reference the new /assets/generated/boostly-splash.*.png files.
The link tags include media attributes matching the image dimensions/orientation so iOS Safari can select the correct splash image.
No existing icon links, manifest link, or social metadata are removed.

requirements.text: Ensure the new splash screen assets are available offline by adding them to the service worker precache list in frontend/public/sw.js.
acceptanceCriteria: frontend/public/sw.js PRECACHE_ASSETS includes the new splash image paths so they are cached during service worker install.
Existing offline behavior continues to work (offline.html remains the navigation fallback).

constraints: Use English for any user-facing text.
Do not edit any files under frontend/src/components/ui or the immutable hook entrypoints listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
Do not serve images from the backend; splash assets must be static files under frontend/public/assets/generated.
nonGoals: Do not redesign the overall site theme or layout.
Do not change the existing PWA icon filenames/sizes already referenced by the manifest and index.html.
Do not add new authentication methods or third-party integrations.
